nodes.content: Progression on osimertinib or amivantamab-vmjw + lazertinib

• Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery) for limited lesions
• Continue osimertinib or amivantamab-vmjw + lazertinib

• Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SRS)
• Continue osimertinib or amivantamab-vmjw + lazertinib
• NCCN Guidelines for CNS Cancers

• Consider definitive local therapy (eg, SABR or surgery)
• Continue osimertinib or amivantamab-vmjw + lazertinib
or
• Therapy for multiple lesions, below

Amivantamab-vmjw (if not previously given) + carboplatin + pemetrexed (nonsquamous) (category 1) (preferred)
or
Systemic therapy
Adenocarcinoma (NSCL-K 1 of 5)
or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (NSCL-K 2 of 5)
Progression, see therapy for multiple lesions below

tree_references.description: Systemic therapy for Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy
Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis

tree_references.to_tree: NCCN Guidelines for Small Cell Lung Cancer
tree_references.description: Referenced in footnote aaa regarding SCLC transformation

footnotes.label: o
footnotes.content: IGTA therapy (eg, cryotherapy, microwave, radiofrequency) may be an option for select patients. See Principles of Image-Guided Thermal Ablation Therapy (NSCL-D).

footnotes.label: nn
footnotes.content: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H).

footnotes.label: rr
footnotes.content: Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease (NSCL-J).

footnotes.label: tt
footnotes.content: Prophylactic anticoagulation is recommended at the time of initiation to prevent venous thromboembolic events.

footnotes.label: yy
footnotes.content: Beware of flare phenomenon in subset of patients who discontinue tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI). If disease flare occurs, restart TKI.

footnotes.label: zz
footnotes.content: Clinical trials have included up to 3 to 5 progressing sites.

footnotes.label: aaa
footnotes.content: Consider a biopsy at time of progression to rule out small cell lung cancer (SCLC) transformation (approximately 6%) and biopsy or plasma testing to evaluate mechanisms of resistance. See Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H) and NCCN Guidelines for Small Cell Lung Cancer.

footnotes.label: bbb
footnotes.content: Definitive local therapy of CNS disease can include asymptomatic lesions at risk for symptomatic progression based on factors including site, location, and edema.

footnotes.label: ccc
footnotes.content: Not an option for EGFR S768I, L861Q, and/or G719X mutations.

footnotes.label: ddd
footnotes.content: Afatinib + cetuximab may be considered in patients with disease progression on EGFR TKI therapy.

footnotes.label: eee
footnotes.content: The data in the second-line setting suggest that programmed cell death protein 1 (PD-1)/PD-L1 inhibitor monotherapy is less effective, irrespective of PD-L1 expression, in EGFR exon 19 deletion or exon 21 L858R, ALK+ NSCLC.

image_title: EGFR EXON 19 DELETION OR EXON 21 L858R MUTATIONS - SUBSEQUENT THERAPY
